title: Inside this Issue
summary: The document covers updates on Paid Family and Medical Leave (PFMLA) benefits, including changes to premium sharing agreements under the Washington State Law (RCW 50A.10.030(1)(d)). It also discusses collective bargaining rights under labor laws (PERC cases), organizational contact information, and record-keeping requirements under the Public Records Act.
compressed_content: PFMLA benefits include changes to premium sharing agreements. PERC cases highlight collective bargaining rights and status quo rules. PRA statute of limitations applies to claims after final agency response. Organizational contact information is provided for fire departments. Legal updates on record-keeping requirements are detailed.
search_text:
Fireho Volume 21, Number 5 Be sure to visit the library to get a glimpse at our various practice areas concerning public agencies' employment relations and collective bargaining. This article discusses changes to the billing of the employees' share of the employee's premium under the paid family and medical leave act (PFMLA), codified at Title 50A of the Revised Code of Washington. Our office is legal counsel to more than 40 Fire Departments in the State of Washington.

The law firm of Eric T. Quinn, P.S. is legal counsel to more than 40 Fire Departments in the State of Washington. Our office is legal counsel to more than 40 Fire Departments in the State of Washington.
